intro: Lampranthus furvus, commonly known as the firecracker plant, is a member of the Aizoaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often resembling firecrackers. The plant thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. It is drought-tolerant and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. Lampranthus furvus is also known for its ability to bloom profusely during the summer months.
